introduction.p: General PCC Grading Guidelines are found at catalog.pcc.edu/handbook/g301-gradingguidelines.

paragraphs.title: Attendance
paragraphs.p: It is important for success in the course to participate with in-class discussion. And yet during the pandemic, it can be difficult or impossible to attend everyday, especially for those of us with child care concerns or unpredictable work schedules.
To help motivate attendance when possible, attendance each live class session is worth 0.25% of your final grade, up to a total of 4.25%.
And if you miss the live session, simply watch the entire class recording when you are able to, and then send me an email confirming that you watched it. I will count that for the 0.25% of the grade.

paragraphs.title: Discussion Posts
paragraphs.p: There are three discussion posts in D2L where your participation is required for 1.25% of your grade (each).

paragraphs.title: Written Homework
paragraphs.p:
Most weeks there is written homework, due by the end of the day on the following Thursday. Turn this in using D2L. The purpose of these assignments is to let me give feedback on:
your process for solving problems
elements of how you explain your work to others
graphical objects you will create that cannot be automatically assessed by a computer
One score will be assigned for each written assignment. Each written assignment is worth 3% of your final grade, for a total of 24%.

paragraphs.title: Online Homework
paragraphs.p: You have online homework each week using . See for details. The due date for each assignment is posted in . It will always be due the following Tuesday evening at 10:00pm. You should start working on a homework set soon after class while the discussion is still fresh.
Collectively, all the online homework is worth 18% of your final grade.

paragraphs.title: Exams
paragraphs.p: There will be exams on April 22, May 27, and June 8. The first two exams are each worth 15% of your final grade. The final exam is worth 20% of your final grade.
